title: Arkansas Lottery Cash 3, Cash 4 winning numbers for Aug. 24, 2025
description: Check your tickets for Arkansas daily lottery draw games here.
content:
The Arkansas Lottery offers several draw games for those aiming to win big. Here’s a look at Sunday, Aug. 24, 2025 results for each game:

Check Lucky For Life payouts and previous drawings here.

When are the Arkansas Lottery drawings held?

Winning lottery numbers are sponsored by Jackpocket, the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network.

Where can you buy lottery tickets?

Tickets can be purchased in person at gas stations, convenience stores and grocery stores. Some airport terminals may also sell lottery tickets.

You can also order tickets online through Jackpocket, the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network, in these U.S. states and territories: Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Idaho, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Puerto Rico, Washington D.C., and West Virginia. The Jackpocket app allows you to pick your lottery game and numbers, place your order, see your ticket and collect your winnings all using your phone or home computer.

Jackpocket is the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network. Gannett may earn revenue for audience referrals to Jackpocket services. GAMBLING PROBLEM? CALL 1-800-GAMBLER, Call 877-8-HOPENY/text HOPENY (467369) (NY). 18+ (19+ in NE, 21+ in AZ). Physically present where Jackpocket operates. Jackpocket is not affiliated with any State Lottery. Eligibility Restrictions apply. Void where prohibited. Terms: jackpocket.com/tos.

This results page was generated automatically using information from TinBu and a template written and reviewed by an Arkansas editor. You can send feedback using this form.

This article originally appeared on Fort Smith Times Record: Arkansas Lottery Cash 3, Cash 4 winning numbers for Aug. 24, 2025
summary: The Arkansas Lottery offers several draw games, including the Cash 3, Cash 4 and Lucky For Life. Tickets can be purchased at gas stations, convenience stores, and some airport terminals. Online purchases can also be made through Jackpocket, the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network. The app allows users to select the winning numbers and collect their winnings using their phone or home computer.
shortSummary: The Arkansas Lottery offers various draw games, including Cash 3, Cash 4, and Lucky For Life, with winners announced via Jackpocket, which is also offering online options.

Environmental Funds
Colorado Schools

$5,000!
Drawings at 12:59 P.M. Monday - Saturday
And at 6:59 P.M. Monday - Sunday
Recent Cash 4 Drawings
How To Play
Cash 4
PICK YOUR NUMBERS: Select a four-digit number from 0000 to 9999. Use a playslip to mark your numbers or mark the Quick Pick (QP) box for randomly-generated numbers.
BUY YOUR TICKET: Select a play amount of either 50 cents or $1. The play will default to $1 if no amount is marked. Printed Cash 4 tickets can only be canceled within 20 minutes after printing. ASL retailers cannot cancel Cash 4 tickets sold for a given draw after sales have been suspended for that drawing.
PLAY MULTIPLE DRAWINGS: To play in more than one Cash 4 draw, select up to 14 Multi Draws – up to 14 draws for midday or evening draws each, or up to 28 draws for both midday and evening. Mark DAY to play in the next midday Cash 4 draw, or EVE to play in the next evening draw. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next draw. Choose BOTH to play the next two Cash 4 draws, one midday and one evening. Mark the day of the week you wish to play Cash 4. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next Cash 4 draw.
CHECK YOUR TICKETS: Winning numbers are available at MyArkansasLottery.com or from your local retailer. Find a retailer near you.
PLAYSLIP INSTRUCTIONS
1) Mark a wager amount with a blue or black ink pen or a pencil. The default amount is $1 if not marked. Double-check your completed playslip and present to ASL retailer to receive a printed ticket. Printed Cash 4 tickets can only be canceled within 20 minutes after printing. ASL retailers cannot cancel Cash 4 tickets sold for a given draw after sales have been suspended for that drawing.
2) Mark up to five plays per playslip, marked Play A through Play E. Each represents a different play.
3) If you make a mistake, do not erase. Mark the VOID box and use the next Cash 4 play.
4) Mark QUICK PICK (QP) to have numbers randomly selected by the terminal.
5) Select Cash 4 play type: STR (Match numbers in the exact order drawn), BOX (Match numbers in any order), STR/BOX (Combine a 50 cent STRAIGHT play and a 50 cent BOX play) or COMBO (Equal to a STRAIGHT play for every combination possible for the number selected). If not marked, the ticket will default to STRAIGHT play.
6) Mark only one number per column, select four numbers between 0 and 9, any of which can be the same.
7) To play in more than one Cash 4 draw, select up to 14 multi-draws – up to 14 draws for midday or evening draws each -- or up to 28 draws for both midday and evening.
8) Mark DAY to play in the next midday Cash 4 draw, or EVE to play in the next evening draw. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next draw. Choose BOTH to play next two Cash 4 draws, one midday and one evening.
9) Mark the day of the week you want your Cash 4 play to start. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next Cash 4 draw.

DRAWINGS AT 8 P.M. DAILY
Sales cut off at 7:59 p.m.
Recent Natural State Jackpot Drawings
How To Play
Natural State Jackpot
1. PICK YOUR NUMBERS: Select five numbers from 1 to 39. Use a playslip to mark your numbers or mark the Quick Pick (QP) box for randomly-generated numbers.
2. BUY YOUR TICKET: Each NSJ ticket costs $1 per play. NSJ sales are suspended one minute prior to the draw. Once a NSJ ticket has been printed, it cannot be canceled. NSJ tickets must be purchased from a licensed lottery retailer. Find a retailer near you.
3. PLAY MULTIPLE DRAWINGS: Request from 2 to 20 Multi Draws either on the playslip or through the retailer. Multi Draws will include the next upcoming draw and be consecutive from that draw. Draws cannot be skipped.
4. CHECK YOUR TICKETS: Winning numbers are available at MyArkansasLottery.com or from your local retailer.
PLAYSLIP INSTRUCTIONS
1) Fill out Natural State Jackpot playslips with pencil or blue or black ink -- not red ink. Each Natural State Jackpot play costs $1. Mark up to five plays per playslip (Play A-Play E).
2) If you make a mistake, do not erase. Mark the VOID box and use the next play.
3) Mark five numbers from 1 to 39 in the play area.
4) Mark Quick Pick (QP) to have the numbers randomly selected at the terminal.
5) To play multiple upcoming draws, mark from two to 20 multi-draws at the bottom of the playslip for $1 each. Each multi-draw will include the next Natural State Jackpot draw. Draws cannot be skipped.
6) Double-check the completed playslip and present to ASL retailer to receive a printed ticket. Printed Natural State Jackpot tickets cannot be canceled.
7) Natural State Jackpot players are bound by Arkansas law and OAL game rules, regulations and policies. NSJ ticket buyers must be 18 years of age or older. Claims must be pursuant with OAL rules as the sole remedy of the claimant. PLEASE PLAY RESPONSIBLY.

Arkansas Lottery Cash 3, Cash 4 winning numbers for Aug. 24, 2025
The Arkansas Lottery offers several draw games for those aiming to win big. Here’s a look at Sunday, Aug. 24, 2025 results for each game:
Winning Cash 3 numbers from Aug. 24 drawing
Evening: 3-7-0
Check Cash 3 payouts and previous drawings here.
Winning Cash 4 numbers from Aug. 24 drawing
Evening: 4-3-3-3
Check Cash 4 payouts and previous drawings here.
Winning Lucky For Life numbers from Aug. 24 drawing
09-16-18-25-42, Lucky Ball: 15
Check Lucky For Life payouts and previous drawings here.
Winning Natural State Jackpot numbers from Aug. 24 drawing
04-06-08-15-19
Check Natural State Jackpot payouts and previous drawings here.
Feeling lucky? Explore the latest lottery news & results
When are the Arkansas Lottery drawings held?
- Powerball: 9:59 p.m. CT on Monday, Wednesday, and Saturday.
- Mega Millions: 10 p.m. CT on Tuesday and Friday.
- Cash 3 Midday: 12:59 p.m. CT daily except Sunday.
- Cash 3 Evening: 6:59 p.m. CT daily.
- Cash 4 Midday: 12:59 p.m. CT daily except Sunday.
- Cash 4 Evening: 6:59 p.m. CT daily.
- Lucky For Life: 9:30 p.m. CT daily.
- Natural State Jackpot: 8 p.m. CT daily except Sunday.
- LOTTO: 9 p.m. CT on Wednesday and Saturday.
Winning lottery numbers are sponsored by Jackpocket, the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network.
Where can you buy lottery tickets?
Tickets can be purchased in person at gas stations, convenience stores and grocery stores. Some airport terminals may also sell lottery tickets.
You can also order tickets online through Jackpocket, the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network, in these U.S. states and territories: Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Idaho, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Puerto Rico, Washington D.C., and West Virginia. The Jackpocket app allows you to pick your lottery game and numbers, place your order, see your ticket and collect your winnings all using your phone or home computer.
Jackpocket is the official digital lottery courier of the USA TODAY Network. Gannett may earn revenue for audience referrals to Jackpocket services. GAMBLING PROBLEM? CALL 1-800-GAMBLER, Call 877-8-HOPENY/text HOPENY (467369) (NY). 18+ (19+ in NE, 21+ in AZ). Physically present where Jackpocket operates. Jackpocket is not affiliated with any State Lottery. Eligibility Restrictions apply. Void where prohibited. Terms: jackpocket.com/tos.

Recent Cash 3 Drawings
How To Play
Cash 3
PICK YOUR NUMBERS: Select a three-digit number from 000 to 999. Use a playslip to mark your numbers or mark the Quick Pick (QP) box for randomly-generated numbers.
BUY YOUR TICKET: Select a play amount of either 50 cents or $1. The play will default to $1 if no amount is marked. Printed Cash 3 tickets can only be canceled within 20 minutes after printing. ASL retailers cannot cancel Cash 3 tickets sold for a given draw after sales have been suspended for that drawing.
PLAY MULTIPLE DRAWINGS: To play in more than one Cash 3 draw, select up to 14 Multi Draws – up to 14 draws for midday or evening draws each, or up to 28 draws for both midday and evening. Mark DAY to play in the next midday Cash 3 draw, or EVE to play in the next evening draw. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next draw. Choose BOTH to play the next two Cash 3 draws, one midday and one evening. Mark the day of the week you wish to play Cash 3. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next Cash 3 draw.
CHECK YOUR TICKETS: Winning numbers are available at MyArkansasLottery.com or from your local retailer. Find a retailer near you.
PLAYSLIP INSTRUCTIONS
1) Mark a wager amount with a blue or black ink pen or a pencil. The default amount is $1 if not marked. Double-check your completed playslip and present to ASL retailer to receive a printed ticket. Printed Cash 3 tickets can only be canceled within 20 minutes after printing. ASL retailers cannot cancel Cash 3 tickets sold for a given draw after sales have been suspended for that drawing.
2) Mark up to five plays per playslip, marked Play A through Play E. Each represents a different play.
3) If you make a mistake, do not erase. Mark the VOID box and use the next Cash 3 play.
4) Mark QUICK PICK (QP) to have numbers randomly selected by the terminal.
5) Select Cash 3 play type: STR (Match numbers in the exact order drawn), BOX (Match numbers in any order), STR/BOX (Combine a 50 cent STRAIGHT play and a 50 cent BOX play) or COMBO (Equal to a STRAIGHT play for every combination possible for the number selected). If not marked, the ticket will default to STRAIGHT play.
6) Mark only one number per column, select three numbers between 0 and 9, any of which can be the same.
7) To play in more than one Cash 3 draw, select up to 14 multi-draws - up to 14 draws for midday or evening draws each, or up to 28 draws for both midday and evening.
8) Mark DAY to play in the next midday Cash 3 draw, or EVE to play in the next evening draw. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next draw. Choose BOTH to play next two Cash 3 draws, one midday and one evening.
9) Mark the day of the week you want your Cash 3 play to start. If not marked, the ticket will be for the next Cash 3 draw.

$1.5 Billion in Proceeds, 822,000+ Scholarships!
Since 2009, more than $1.5 billion in scholarship proceeds have been raised by the Arkansas Scholarship Lottery. That’s more than 822,000 Arkansas Academic Challenge Scholarships awarded so far!

Lucky for Life® is a multi-state draw game. Drawings are held at 9:30 p.m. CT every day. Note: Draw sales end at 8:30 p.m. CT. Five numbered balls are drawn from 1 to 48, and one Lucky Ball number is drawn from 1 to 18. If all your numbers match those that are chosen, you win the top prize, which is $7,000 a week for life. The second-level Lucky for Life® prize is $25,000 a year for life. Each Lucky for Life® play is $2.
LUCKY FOR LIFE® FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:
Playing Lucky for Life®
Q: Where is Lucky for Life® drawn?
A: Lucky for Life® drawings are held in Des Moines, IA. Previous draws are available to watch online at www.luckyforlife.us.
Q: Is it possible for the Lucky Ball number to be the same as one of the five white ball numbers?
A: Yes. The five white ball numbers and the one Lucky Ball number are drawn from separate sets of balls, so the Lucky Ball number could be the same as one of the white ball numbers.
Q: Which has better odds – picking my own numbers or requesting a Quick Pick?
A: Whether you pick your own numbers or have the terminal randomly select numbers for you, the odds of winning are the same.
Points for Prizes®
Q: Can I enter non-winning Lucky for Life® tickets in Points for Prizes®?
A: Yes. Winning and non-winning numbers from terminal-generated games like Lucky for Life® are eligible. Visit https://theclub.aslplayerservices.com/pia to enter and add Points for Prizes® points to your account. Points for Prizes® codes from terminal-generated games not associated with a draw must be entered within 180 days of purchase date whereas draw related games are based on the last draw date printed on the front of the ticket. Look for the 20 digit Points for Prizes Code.
Purchasing Tickets
Q: How much do Lucky for Life® tickets cost?
A: Lucky for Life® tickets cost $2 per play.
Q: Can I purchase Lucky for Life® tickets in advance?
A: To play multiple upcoming draws, request from 2 to 20 Multi Draws either on the playslip or through the retailer. Multi Draws will include the next upcoming draw and be consecutive from that draw. Draws cannot be skipped.
Q: How late can I purchase Lucky for Life® tickets on a draw night?
A: Lucky for Life® sales are suspended at 8:30 p.m. CT.
Q: Can a Lucky for Life® ticket be voided or canceled?
A: No. Once a Lucky for Life® ticket has been printed, it cannot be canceled.
Q: Can I buy Lucky for Life® tickets online or by mail?
A: No. Lucky for Life® tickets must be purchased from a licensed lottery retailer.
Prizes and Claims
Q: Do Lucky for Life® tickets expire?
A: Prizes must be claimed within 180 days of the draw date on which the prize was won.
Q: Do I have to match the Lucky for Life® numbers in the exact order drawn?
A: No. The order of the five white balls drawn does not matter, but the one Lucky Ball number drawn must match the Lucky Ball number on your ticket.
Q: Can I redeem a winning Lucky for Life® ticket in any state?
A: Although the winning numbers are the same in all Lucky for Life® states, a ticket must be redeemed in the state in which it was purchased.
Q: I lost my ticket. Can I claim a prize with a playslip or store receipt?
A: Lucky for Life® prizes can only be claimed with a ticket printed from the lottery terminal. Playslips or store receipts will not constitute proof of purchase. Lottery tickets are bearer instruments, meaning the person who presents the ticket for claim will be presumed to be the owner. Always sign the back of any lottery ticket immediately. If you lose a ticket before you sign it, you no longer have valid ownership of the ticket.
Lucky for Life® Top Prize
Q: What happens if more than one person wins the Lucky for Life® top prize?
A: If there is more than one Lucky for Life® top prize-winning ticket, the prize may be split equally among the winners. This may apply to multiple prize tiers. See official game rules for more details.
Q: Why does a top prize winner receive a smaller amount than the advertised prize?
A: The advertised annuitized Lucky for Life® top prize is paid less appropriate taxes and withholdings. See official game rules for more details.
Q: What happens if a prize is not claimed?
A: If a prize is not claimed within the time frame set by the jurisdiction in which it was won (180 days in Arkansas), the prize funds will be returned to the states based on each state’s proportion of the sales that contributed to the prize.
Q: What happens if an annuity prize winner dies?
A: A single Lucky for Life® top prize winner will be paid for the natural life of that individual. For more than one winner, Lucky for Life’s top prize will be paid for 20 years. Certain limitations may apply. See official game rules for more details.
For more information, please visit www.luckyforlife.us.

Jackpocket Terms of Service
Last Modified: June 24, 2025
THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE SUBJECT TO A WAIVER OF TRIAL BY JURY.
These terms and conditions ("Terms of Service") govern your use of the Application (as defined below) as provided by Jackpocket LLC ("Jackpocket," the "Company," "We" or "Us"). These Terms of Service are a binding legal agreement between you and Jackpocket. Jackpocket may change these Terms of Service at any time without notice to you by posting the revised Terms of Service with the date they were revised.
When ordering a lottery ticket through Jackpocket, you are placing an order for a lottery ticket and not purchasing a lottery ticket directly. As a service provider and acting on your behalf, Jackpocket will fulfill that order through a licensed lottery retailer in the jurisdiction where the order was placed.
IMPORTANT LEGAL NOTICE: PLEASE READ THESE TERMS OF SERVICE CAREFULLY AS THEY AFFECT YOUR LEGAL RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS. JACKPOCKET LLC IS NOT AFFILIATED, OR ENDORSED BY ANY STATE LOTTERY OR GOVERNMENT AGENCY. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS OF SERVICE IN THEIR ENTIRETY, DO NOT ACCESS OR USE THE SERVICE.
1. Defined Terms
For the purpose of these Terms of Service:
2. User Agreement
By accessing the Application, creating an account via the Application (an "Account"), or clicking to accept or agree to these Terms of Service when this option is made available to you, you hereby (a) acknowledge that you have read and agree to be bound to and abide by these Terms of Service; (b) represent and warrant that you are eligible to access the Application and are authorized and able to accept these Terms of Service; and (c) acknowledge that you have read Jackpocket's Privacy Policy, available at https://myaccount.jackpocket.com/documents/lottery-privacy-policy, and agree that Jackpocket may collect, process, store, and disclose your information consistent with such policy. If you do not wish to be bound by these Terms of Service, you must not access or use the Application. By declining to accept these Terms of Service, you will be unable to create an Account or access or use the Application.
We reserve the right to change these Terms of Service at any time without prior notice to you. If we make what we determine to be material changes to these Terms of Service, we will notify you by prominently posting a notice or by sending a notice to the e-mail address on file. It is your obligation to provide us with notice of any change to your e-mail address by sending us notice immediately to support@jackpocket.com. Your continued use of the Application following any changes constitutes your affirmative consent to the changes. If you do not agree to the changes, your sole remedy is to cease using the Application and close your Account. You can permanently close your Account at any time for any reason by e-mailing support@jackpocket.com or through the Login & Security tab of the Account Information page. You are expected to check this page each time you access the Application so you are aware of any changes, as they are binding on you.
3. Eligibility
In order to create an Account, order Tickets and/or claim prizes on the Application, you must, at the time of registration:
If you reside in a Jurisdiction that requires you to be nineteen (19) or twenty-one (21) years of age or older to participate in a Lottery, you must adhere to that Jurisdiction's laws in order to use the Application. If you do not meet all of these requirements, you must not access or use the Application. Jackpocket reserves the right to verify your age and/or identity and eligibility at any time. Any failure to cooperate with Jackpocket in this respect may result in the suspension and/or termination of your Account. Eligibility determinations are made by Jackpocket, in its sole discretion.
BY ACCESSING OR USING THE APPLICATION, YOU REPRESENT AND WARRANT THAT YOU HAVE THE RIGHT, AUTHORITY AND CAPACITY TO ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT, TO ABIDE BY ALL OF THESE TERMS OF SERVICE, THAT YOU ARE NOT PROHIBITED OR RESTRICTED FROM ACCESSING OR USING THE APPLICATION, AND THAT YOU MEET ALL OF THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH ABOVE. THE COMPANY MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, IMPLICIT OR EXPLICIT, AS TO YOUR LEGAL RIGHT TO ACCESS OR USE THE APPLICATION AND NO PERSON AFFILIATED, OR CLAIMING AFFILIATION, WITH JACKPOCKET SHALL HAVE AUTHORITY TO MAKE ANY SUCH REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES. JACKPOCKET DOES NOT INTEND FOR THE APPLICATION TO BE USED BY PERSONS PRESENT IN JURISDICTIONS IN WHICH PARTICIPATION IS PROHIBITED OR RESTRICTED. YOU AGREE THAT THE AVAILABILITY OF THE APPLICATION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE AN OFFER, SOLICITATION OR INVITATION BY JACKPOCKET FOR THE USE OF THE APPLICATION IN ANY JURISDICTION IN WHICH SUCH ACTIVITIES ARE PROHIBITED OR RESTRICTED. JACKPOCKET RESERVES THE RIGHT TO DENY ACCESS TO THE APPLICATION TO ANYONE AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION.
4. User Accounts
h. Account Termination. Your Account may be suspended or terminated and prize funds may be returned to the Regulator, if applicable, for:
In the event of Account suspension, Jackpocket may, in its sole discretion, restrict all Account functionality, including but not limited to orders (including, without limitation, Smart Orders or pre-paid orders), claims, Account Funding and withdrawals. Registered Users of Accounts for which suspension escalates to Account termination may be subject to forfeiture of prizes awarded for Winning Tickets back to the Regulator, and will be permanently restricted from using this Application in any capacity. Jackpocket may also restrict any person or entity found to be using or attempting to be using the Application fraudulently, or with intent to commit fraud, disrupt the Application, or create harm to Jackpocket, its Users, or any third party, including for research or any other purpose outside of the stated purposes of the Application.
Users can also unsubscribe from the Application. To unsubscribe from the Jackpocket Application and de-activate your Account, by e-mailing support@Jackpocket.com or through the Login & Security tab of the Account Information page. You will need to delete the Application to complete the process. Jackpocket is under no obligation to permanently delete any data except as otherwise may be set forth in our Privacy Policy. USERS CANNOT DEACTIVATE THEIR ACCOUNT IF THEY HAVE ANY PENDING OR IN-PROCESS FUND REQUESTS OR IF THEIR ACCOUNT IS ALREADY LOCKED.
5. Account Funding, Orders and Withdrawals
Except for Lottery Credits, you may withdraw funds from your Account at any time. Except for Lottery Credits, funds from your Account can be withdrawn to a bank account and will usually take 3-5 business days to complete, but may take longer due to unusual circumstances. If you do not receive your funds within 5 business days of your withdrawal request, please contact support@Jackpocket.com for additional assistance. In the event of the death of a Jackpocket User, all available funds in your Account, with the exception of Lottery Credits, will be paid in accordance with these Terms of Service, to the Executor or similarly functioning representative under his/her last will and testament or, if there is no will, in accordance with the laws of the state of his/her legal residence. Jackpocket may, in its sole discretion, require proof and documentation to establish that the User is deceased and the individual or entity claiming the funds in an Account is entitled to them before paying such funds.
Each time you use the Application to fund your Account with a single transaction, you agree to the following: "I authorize Jackpocket to debit the account indicated for the amount noted on today's date. I will not dispute Jackpocket debiting my account, so long as the transaction corresponds to the terms in this online form and my agreement with Jackpocket."
You must ensure that your name on any Ticket order you place through the Application always matches your bank account name. The authorized bank account holder will be deemed the Ticket holder in the event of any dispute.
If asked to enter the last 4 digits of your social security number you agree to the following: "I certify, under penalty of perjury that: 1) The Taxpayer Identification Number or Social Security Number I provided is correct; 2) I am not subject to backup withholding because: (a) I am exempt from backup withholding, or (b) I have not been notified by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) that I am subject to backup withholding as a result of a failure to report all interest or dividends, or (c) the IRS has notified me that I am no longer subject to backup withholding; and 3) I am a U.S. citizen or other U.S. person; and 4) The FATCA code(s) entered (if any) indicating that I am exempt from FATCA reporting is correct. The Internal Revenue Service does not require your consent to any provision of this document other than the certifications required to avoid backup withholding."
You must ensure that your name on any Ticket order you place through the Application always matches your debit account name. The authorized debit account holder will be deemed the Ticket holder in the event of any dispute.
You authorize Jackpocket to share your identity and Account data with PayPal and/or Venmo, as applicable, for the purposes of supporting such account, and you are responsible for the accuracy and completeness of that data.
You must ensure that your name on any Ticket order you place through the Application always matches your PayPal or Venmo account name, as applicable. The authorized account holder will be deemed the Ticket holder in the event of any dispute.
Any underlying funding source used through PayPal or Venmo must be a permitted funding source for ordering lottery tickets in the jurisdiction in which you place your order.
6. Jackpocket Application Services
Upon registering with Jackpocket, you will be able to utilize the Application to order official Tickets over the internet; log into your Account; view past Tickets and upcoming Tickets; manage your Account; and access other information related to the official state Lotteries.
7. Courier Model and Ticket Orders
Pursuant to N.J.A.C. 17:20-12.5(a)9, Jackpocket is required to disclose our insurance coverages and amounts:
Pursuant to N.J.A.C. 17:20-7.7, holders of winning lottery tickets or shares are anonymous, but may expressly consent to waive their anonymity to allow the following information to be published by the New Jersey Division of the Lottery, its marketing and sales contractors and subcontractors, and lottery couriers, including Jackpocket: (i) name, (ii) town and state of residence, (iii) game name and drawing date, (iv) amount won, and (v) photographic and video-graphic likeness in any medium for purposes of publicity or promotion. In the event a winner remains anonymous, the New Jersey Division of the Lottery, its marketing and sales contractors and subcontractors, and lottery couriers, including Jackpocket, may publish the following: (i) name of the county and state where winner resides, (ii) game name and drawing date, and (iii) amount won. The foregoing does not apply to second chance drawings, contests or giveaways. In such instances, house number, street name, social security numbers, taxpayer ID numbers, driver's license numbers, passport numbers, and any other identifying information, other than individual's name and town of residence, shall remain confidential for all purposes.
Jackpocket is a courier service licensed by the New Jersey Lottery. Please be warned that ordering New Jersey Lottery tickets through a courier service not licensed by the New Jersey Lottery may expose you to fraud or other illegal activity.
Although Jackpocket is licensed by the New Jersey Lottery, it is a separate legal entity and is not a part of the New Jersey Lottery, and the New Jersey Lottery does not guarantee, nor have any liability, for courier customer activities.
Avoid Lottery Scams
This is a warning to all consumers about scammers who are sending false announcements regarding lottery prizes.
As part of the scam, an individual is contacted by phone, email, text message, or a letter from a scammer who is claiming that the recipient has won a prize with a state lottery. Unless you hear from Jackpocket directly, this is a fraudulent claim and there is no such prize. Federal law prohibits the sale or mailing of lottery tickets across state lines. You may only order lottery tickets or set up a Smart Order in the Jurisdiction you are physically located. Never respond to these communications and never provide information or send money to a scammer.
Warning Signs
Report the Scam
Report any attempted scam to the Federal Trade Commission at 1-877-FTC-HELP or at the FTC Consumer Information website.
For Users within New Jersey, contact the New Jersey Lottery's Security Unit immediately at (609) 599-6100. The Security Unit takes these "lottery scams" very seriously, and looks into each particular "scam" in great detail. Please submit the "scam" material you have received, along with as many details as possible (i.e. instructions, your contact information, etc.). You can forward this information to the Security Unit by email (publicinfo@lottery.state.nj.us), by fax (609) 599-5814, ATTN: Security Unit, or via regular mail to New Jersey Lottery; Security Unit; P.O. Box 041; Trenton, NJ 08625-0041.
k.New York Lottery: For those Users located in New York who order Tickets for the New York Lottery games, we are required to disclose the following terms of service to you prior to the creation of an Account and before the placement of any order:
Receipt is not a Ticket. No interactive customer order constitutes evidence of a validly issued lottery ticket. A ticket, in order to be a validly issued ticket, shall be generated as set forth in 9 § 5004.9(a), (d), (p).
Ticket Issuance. A draw game ticket is deemed validly issued at the time such ticket is generated by a lottery terminal authorized by the commission or when a registered ticketless transaction is affected and not when a request for order is made of a digital courier service or a ticket order is placed with an interactive sales agent.
Bet Ticket Responsibility. Lottery tickets are bearer instruments. As such, the New York State Gaming Commission shall not be responsible for: (i) lost or stolen bet tickets; (ii) bet tickets claimed by a customer in error for a lower prize at a lottery sales agent; (iii) bet tickets that are not intact; (iv) bet tickets that are mutilated, altered, reconstituted, counterfeit in whole or in part, or tampered with in any manner, or mis-cut; or (v) bet tickets that have not been issued in an authorized manner, or are mis-registered, defective, or printed or produced in error.
By creating an account using the digital network of an interactive sales agent or of a digital courier service to place an order for lottery tickets, an interactive customer agrees:
i) to be bound by the commission's regulations;
ii) to release and hold harmless the interactive sales agent or digital courier service licensee, the State, and the commission from any liability related to an order for tickets placed through the digital network that is not completed before the drawing cutoff and never results in the generation of the tickets ordered through the digital network; and
iii) that, in the event a dispute occurs as to whether a ticket generated to complete an order placed through a digital network would have been a winning ticket had the ticket purchase occurred and no prize is paid, the commission may, at the commission's option, replace the ticket with a ticket equal in value to the price paid for the ticket that is the subject of the dispute, which remedy shall be the sole and exclusive remedy of the claimant against the commission

8. Winning Tickets and Prize Claiming
In connection with a Ticket redemption, Jackpocket transmits winnings to the User's Account if the winnings are under the In-Store Redemption Threshold. You consent to Jackpocket storing any Ticket on your behalf.
Once the drawing and prize results are in, Jackpocket will notify you in the Application and email you to let you know if your Ticket is a Winning Ticket. If it is a Winning Ticket and the prize value is less than or equal to the In-Store Redemption Threshold, Jackpocket will credit your Account for the full prize value, as further described in Section 8(a) below. If a Winning Ticket has a prize value worth more than the In-Store Redemption Threshold, Jackpocket will arrange for delivery or pickup of the Winning Ticket to the User or to the Regulator, as further described in Section 8(b) below.
Prize claims made through this Application are subject to the prize payout rules and regulations set forth by the Regulator. Jackpocket may provide the Regulator with any User Personal Information as requested by the Regulator, including to process prize claims. Such information may include, but is not limited to, the full name, address and phone number listed in your Account.
a. Winning Tickets with prizes totaling less than or equal to the In-store Redemption Threshold. By using the Application you authorize Jackpocket to store and claim Winning Tickets with prize totals that are less than or equal to the In-Store Redemption Threshold in the Jurisdiction of purchase on your behalf at an authorized lottery retailer once drawing results are posted. Neither Jackpocket nor the licensed retailers from which Jackpocket collects these prizes will withhold any applicable taxes on your behalf . Jackpocket will deposit the full prize value into your Jackpocket Account. With the exception of Lottery Credits, funds in your Account can be transferred to an eligible checking or savings account in accordance with these Terms of Service.
For New Jersey Customers, if you desire to opt-out of authorizing Jackpocket to claim these types of Winning Tickets, you can do so by contacting support@jackpocket.com, specifying whether you want the Winning Tickets to be delivered (i) via a nationally recognized courier or mail service at Jackpocket's expense, or (ii) by hand at our processing location.
For non-New York customers, if the official prize for the Winning Ticket is a free Ticket for a separate drawing, then Jackpocket may either provide the User with the new Ticket or credit the User with a Lottery Credit equal to the purchase value that the new Ticket would cost if purchased. For New York customers, if the official prize for the Winning Ticket is a free Ticket for a separate drawing, then Jackpocket will provide the User with the new Ticket.
You are ultimately responsible for paying any tax liability associated with claims made through this Application for Winning Tickets with prizes that are less than or equal to the In-Store Redemption Threshold in the state of purchase . The In-Store Redemption Threshold varies by Jurisdiction, but is typically around $600. Check your Regulator's official website for more information.
b.Winning Tickets with prizes greater than the In-store Redemption Threshold. Claims for Winning Tickets with prizes totaling more than the In-Store Redemption Threshold and up to $10,000 will, at your option, be delivered (i) via a nationally recognized courier or mail service at Jackpocket's expense, or (ii) by hand at our processing location. For non-New York customers claiming Winning Tickets worth more than $10,000, the customer will be required to pick up the ticket in person, subject to the in-person requirements set forth in the next paragraph. For New York customers claiming Winning Tickets worth more than $10,000, the customer will still have the option for hand delivery or a nationally recognized courier or mail service. If permitted in your jurisdiction, you agree to allow Jackpocket to send your Winning Ticket, including any required claim information, directly to the Regulator, allowing you to receive a check or other form or method of payment from such Regulator.
JACKPOCKET STRONGLY RECOMMENDS TO NEW YORK WINNERS THAT THEY REQUEST HAND DELIVERY IN PERSON AT THE JACKPOCKET PROCESSING CENTER OF A WINNING TICKET WORTH MORE THAN $10,000.
IN THE EVENT YOU ELECT TO RECEIVE DELIVERY VIA A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED COURIER OR MAIL SERVICE, JACKPOCKET SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY FOR LACK OF DELIVERY, INCORRECT DELIVERY OR MISPLACEMENT OF ANY WINNING TICKET, ONCE SUCH TICKETS ARE PROVIDED BY JACKPOCKET TO THE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED COURIER OR MAIL SERVICE. ANY AMOUNT PAID BY JACKPOCKET IN RELATION TO ANY SUCH WINNING TICKET SHALL NOT BE: (I) AN ADMISSION OF LIABILITY, (II) A REQUIREMENT TO MAKE ADDITIONAL PAYMENTS, OR (III) CONSIDERED A WAIVER OF ANY OF JACKPOCKET'S RIGHTS IN THIS TERMS OF SERVICE.
Winning Tickets greater than the In-Store Redemption Threshold are subject to approval by the Regulator and must be claimed directly from the Regulator either by mail or in person. Claiming rules vary by Jurisdiction. Check your Jurisdiction for more details. The Regulator may withhold taxes from prize distributions for Winning Tickets with claimed prizes totaling more than the In-Store Redemption Threshold. Jackpocket will not be liable for verifying the appropriateness or accuracy of taxes withheld from Users' claims, and Users are solely responsible for handling individual tax situations directly with the applicable Jurisdiction. Jackpocket will not be liable for any unclaimed prizes associated with Winning Tickets ordered through this Application for any reason. You authorize Jackpocket to store any such Winning Tickets until delivery or pick up, as applicable.
Jackpocket requires, and you agree to present a government-issued identification in order to pick up any Winning Ticket associated with your Account. In the event you do pick up a Winning Ticket in person, you agree to take full possession and release Jackpocket from any responsibility for the Winning Ticket, and any associated prize claims, by signing a ticket release form.
In the event that Jackpocket mails you the Winning Ticket, Jackpocket will be responsible for paying for the shipping costs and Jackpocket is released from any liability and responsibility as soon as the packaged Winning Ticket is put into the possession of the mail courier. Prior to or upon shipping, Jackpocket will provide you with an email containing the tracking information for your Winning Ticket. In the event you do not receive your Winning Ticket, you must notify Jackpocket within fifteen (15) days following receipt of the email containing the tracking information so that Jackpocket may notify the courier or mail service. You are responsible for ensuring the accuracy of your mailing address. At no time will Non-Winning Tickets be available for in-person pick up or mailing.
JACKPOCKET IS NOT RESPONSIBLE OR LIABLE FOR THE PAYMENT OR NON-PAYMENT OF ANY WINNING TICKET WHERE THE PRIZE EXCEEDS THE IN-STORE REDEMPTION THRESHOLD. FOR ANY WINNING TICKET THAT EXCEEDS THE IN-STORE REDEMPTION THRESHOLD, THE LOTTERY THAT ISSUED SUCH WINNING TICKET IS SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PAYMENT OR NON-PAYMENT OF ALL PRIZES FOR THAT TICKET. BY USING THE APPLICATION, YOU HEREBY WAIVE ANY CLAIM AGAINST JACKPOCKET, AND AGREE TO RELEASE AND HOLD HARMLESS JACKPOCKET FROM ANY AND ALL LIABILITY, CLAIMS, ACTIONS, PROCEEDINGS, DAMAGES, LOSSES, COSTS, EXPENSES OR SETTLEMENTS OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER, WHICH DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISE FROM, ARE RELATED TO, OR ARE BASED UPON THE PAYMENT OR NON-PAYMENT OF PRIZES FOR ANY WINNING TICKET THAT EXCEEDS THE IN-STORE REDEMPTION THRESHOLD.
c. Prohibition on Claiming Winning Tickets. You are prohibited from claiming, or attempting to claim, any Winning Tickets in any manner that is inconsistent with the terms of this Section 8. In the event you claim, or attempt to claim, any Winning Ticket in a manner that is inconsistent with this Section, you agree that Jackpocket will have no liability to you with respect to such Winning Ticket, including, without limitation, the obligation to deposit any winnings into your Account associated with such Winning Ticket. Additionally, in the event that you and Jackpocket both claim the prize for any Winning Ticket, Jackpocket has the right to immediately remove any associated winnings from your Account and suspend or terminate your Account. You shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Jackpocket for any claims, losses, expenses and all other liabilities Jackpocket incurs as a result of your failure to comply with these Terms of Service.
d. Winning Ticket is a Bearer Instrument. Note that your ticket is held in trust by Jackpocket as the courier, and a Ticket is a bearer instrument within the meaning of all applicable law, such that the holder of the ticket is presumed to be the owner of the ticket with all applicable rights in the ticket and its proceeds. Therefore, if you obtain possession of your Winning Ticket, do not lose your Ticket or allow others to possess your Ticket. Jackpocket attempts to mitigate this risk by placing the winning customer's name on the back of the Ticket following the ticket being deemed a Winning Ticket, however Jackpocket cannot be held responsible for any lost or stolen tickets or other tickets that, for whatever reason, are not in the winning customer's possession.
9. SMART ORDERS
a. Overview of the Smart Order Feature
Jackpocket offers a feature that enables eligible Users to schedule recurring Ticket orders based on preferences they set ("Smart Order"). For Users with a Smart Order, Jackpocket will place Ticket orders on the User's behalf only when all of your selected criteria in the Smart Order are met.
Eligible criteria may vary depending on the Lottery game selected and may include, but are not limited to:
· Selection of pseudo-randomly generated numbers or selection of specific numbers;
· Number of Tickets to be ordered per Designated Drawing, and
· A jackpot threshold (if available). For certain Lotteries, Smart Order allows Users to set a jackpot threshold, where Smart Order will only place an order for that Lottery when the jackpot meets or exceeds the dollar amount selected through Smart Order. For example only, if a User sets a $500 million jackpot threshold for a specific Lottery, Smart Order will not place an order unless and until the jackpot for that Lottery reaches at least $500 million.
Jackpocket may modify, suspend, or discontinue the Smart Order feature, in whole or in part, at any time and for any reason or no reason, in its sole and absolute discretion.
b. Smart Order Eligibility
Smart Order is available only to Users who are eligible to order Lottery tickets on Jackpocket and who are physically located in a jurisdiction where Smart Order is offered. Smart Order is not offered in New York. Additional geographic or legal restrictions may apply to Smart Orders based on applicable law, regulations, or Lottery-specific rules.
c. Automatic Payment and Order Processing
UNLESS YOU CANCEL YOUR SMART ORDER BEFORE THE NEXT SCHEDULED ORDER IS PLACED, YOU AUTHORIZE JACKPOCKET TO CHARGE THE ORDER TOTAL OF THAT ORDER TO YOUR SELECTED PAYMENT METHOD.
When a Smart Order is triggered based on your selected criteria, Jackpocket will automatically charge the total order cost, including any applicable service fees, to your selected payment method. You authorize Jackpocket to initiate such recurring charges as part of your use of Smart Order.
The exact timing of order placement may vary depending on when a User's Smart Order is processed and the specific criteria a User has selected.
If your selected payment method cannot be charged at the time an order is triggered to be placed through Smart Order, including, but not limited to, due to insufficient funds or an expired payment method, that individual Smart Order will not be placed. Jackpocket will not attempt to place an individual order again in the event your selected payment method cannot be charged at the time of that individual order, but the Smart Order will remain active and future orders will be attempted based on your selected criteria in accordance with your Smart Order. For more information about how payment failures, chargebacks, or insufficient funds are handled, including potential fees and account actions, see Section 5(g): (Chargebacks/Insufficient Fund Charges) of these Terms of Service.
You are solely responsible for ensuring that your selected payment method remains valid and has sufficient funds while your Smart Order is in place.
Jackpocket is not responsible for any failure to place any order related to A SMART ORDER.
d. Cancelling, Pausing, or Editing a Smart Order
YOUR SMART ORDER WILL REMAIN ACTIVE, AND YOUR SELECTED PAYMENT METHOD WILL CONTINUE TO BE CHARGED AUTOMATICALLY, IN EACH CASE, UNTIL YOU CANCEL THE SMART ORDER.
You may cancel your Smart Order at any time. To do so, go to the "Smart Order" section in the Application, select the relevant Smart Order, and click "Delete Smart Order."
You may also update your selected payment method for a Smart Order at any time. To change your payment method for a Smart Order, go to the "Smart Order" section in the Application, select the relevant Smart Order, click "Payment Method," and then follow the prompts to enter the required information.
If you wish to temporarily stop your Smart Order without cancelling the Smart Order, you may pause it at any time. To pause a Smart Order, go to the "Smart Order" section in the Application, select the relevant Smart Order, and toggle the "Smart Order Enabled" switch to off. The Smart Order will be paused until you proactively toggle the "Smart Order Enabled" switch back to on.
You cannot edit the criteria of an existing Smart Order. If you wish to make changes to the criteria of an existing Smart Order-including, but not limited to, selecting a different Lottery, jackpot threshold, or number of Tickets-you must cancel the existing Smart Order and create a new one with your updated preferences.
Any cancellations of a Smart Order will take effect immediately for all future orders that have not yet been triggered or placed through the Smart Order. Once a Ticket order has been placed through a Smart Order that order is final and cannot be cancelled or changed by you.
e. Lottery Ticket Price Increase
In the event a Lottery increases the cost of any Ticket(s), any Smart Orders related to such Ticket(s) will continue at the increased price, and you will be charged and authorize Jackpocket to charge your selected payment method for the increased price, whether or not you have been notified of such price increase by Jackpocket, unless you cancel the Smart Order.
f. Winning Tickets
The process for claiming or redeeming Winning Tickets ordered through Smart Order is the same as for any other Winning Tickets ordered through Jackpocket. See Section 8 (Winning Tickets and Prize Claiming) of these Terms of Use for more information on claiming or redeeming Winning Tickets.
g. Jackpocket Termination of Smart Order
Jackpocket may terminate or suspend any Smart Orders and/or your access to Smart Orders at any time and for any reason or no reason, in Jackpocket??Ts sole and absolute discretion, including but not limited to, in the event of:
In the event Jackpocket terminates or suspends any active Smart Orders, no further orders will be placed in connection with that Smart Order. However, any tickets already ordered through the Smart Order prior to termination or suspension will remain valid and subject to these Terms of Service and applicable laws, regulations, and Lottery rules.
Jackpocket shall not be liable to you for any loss of access to, or malfunctions in, Smart Order, including, without limitation, any cancelled orders, any Tickets that were not purchased in connection with a Smart Order, any malfunctions in a Smart Order or a feature related to a Smart Order, or errors in the settings associated with a Smart Order.
10. PREPAID ORDERS
a. Overview of Prepaid Orders
Jackpocket offers a feature that allows eligible Users to prepay for Ticket orders in advance of future Designated Drawings ("Prepaid Orders"). With a Prepaid Order, Users pay a one-time, upfront amount, including any applicable service fee(s), for a set number of Tickets to future Designated Drawings. Jackpocket will then place the corresponding Ticket orders on the User's behalf until the prepaid balance has been fully used.
Once a Prepaid Order is confirmed and payment is successfully processed, no additional charges will be applied for the applicable Designated Drawings. Prepaid Orders are not recurring and will automatically conclude once the prepaid balance of the Prepaid Order has been fully used.
Jackpocket may modify, suspend, or discontinue the Prepaid Order feature at any time, in whole or in part, at any time and for any reason or no reason, in its sole and absolute discretion, with or without notice to you.
b. Prepaid Order Eligibility
Prepaid Orders are available only to Users who are eligible to order Lottery tickets through Jackpocket and who are physically located in a jurisdiction where Prepaid Orders are offered. Additional geographic or legal restrictions may apply based on applicable laws, regulations, or Lottery-specific rules.
c. Payment and Order Fulfillment
When you place a Prepaid Order, you authorize Jackpocket to charge the full, upfront cost-including any applicable service fees-for the Prepaid Order to your selected payment method. No further charges will be made for that Prepaid Order after this initial payment.
Ticket orders associated with a Prepaid Order will be placed for each drawing as scheduled, and you will receive order confirmations in accordance with Jackpocket's standard process.
If your payment for a Prepaid Order cannot be successfully processed at the time of placing the Prepaid Order, no Tickets will be ordered, and the Prepaid Order will not be initiated. Jackpocket will not attempt to retry a failed Prepaid Order payment.
d. Cancelling or Modifying a Prepaid Order
ONCE A PREPAID ORDER IS PLACED AND PAYMENT IS PROCESSED, IT CANNOT BE CANCELLED, REFUNDED, OR MODIFIED.
Jackpocket does not support cancellations, changes to drawing dates, changes to number selections, or any other changes to criteria, in each case, related to a Prepaid Order that has been placed.
e. Lottery Ticket Price Increase
In the event a Lottery increases the cost of any Ticket(s) related to a Prepaid Order, Jackpocket will automatically cancel the remaining unfulfilled portion of the Prepaid Order and issue you a pro rata refund of the Prepaid Order based on the number of Designated Drawings remaining after the price increase.
For example, if you prepaid for 10 Tickets to Designated Drawings and a price increase occurs after 5 Tickets have been ordered, Jackpocket will cancel the remaining 5 Tickets and refund to you half of the payment you made for such Prepaid Order.
In the event your Prepaid Order is canceled due to a Lottery increasing the cost of Tickets, you may place a new order at the updated Ticket price if you choose to do so.
f. Winning Tickets
The process for claiming or redeeming Winning Tickets ordered through a Prepaid Order is the same as for any other Winning Tickets ordered through Jackpocket. See Section 8 (Winning Tickets and Prize Claiming) of these Terms of Service for more information on claiming or redeeming Winning Tickets.
g. Jackpocket Termination of Prepaid Orders
Jackpocket may terminate or suspend Prepaid Orders and/or your access to this feature at any time and for any reason or no reason, in Jackpocket??Ts sole and absolute discretion, including but not limited to, in the event of:
In the event Jackpocket terminates a Prepaid Order before all Tickets are fulfilled, and such termination is not the result of your violation of these Terms of Service, Jackpocket may, at its sole and absolute discretion, issue a pro rata refund for the unused portion of the terminated Prepaid Order.
Jackpocket shall not be liable to you for any loss of access to, or malfunction in, Prepaid Orders, including, without limitation, any terminated Prepaid Orders, any Tickets that were not purchased in connection with a Prepaid Order, malfunctions of any features related to Prepaid Orders, or errors in the settings associated with a Prepaid Order.
11. Quick Picks
Users may elect to utilize this Application to generate and/or order pseudo-random plays. By using Jackpocket, you understand and acknowledge that, as is common in random number generators, the Quick Pick randomization process is seeded by the timestamp of its initial generation request (as recorded by Jackpocket) and, as such, cannot be classified a "True Random Number" by definition. You further understand that Jackpocket cannot be held responsible for the numbers chosen for any of the pseudo-randomly generated Plays derived through this system.
12. Playing Scratch Offs
If Jackpocket permits users to order scratch off tickets in your Jurisdiction, you are subject to the following terms for any such order, in addition to the other terms and conditions of this Terms of Service. Solely with regard to scratch off orders, to the extent there is any contradiction between the terms of this Section 11 and the terms of the remainder of this Terms of Service, the terms of this Section 11 shall prevail.
By ordering scratch off tickets, you agree to the terms, conditions, and game rules provided on each ticket and published by the lottery commission in your jurisdiction.
You authorize Jackpocket to collect your personal information, including your mailing address, and to share such information, including your identity and mailing address with any third-party delivery provider. YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS OF THAT DATA, INCLUDING THE MAILING ADDRESS. IN THE EVENT YOU PROVIDE AN INCORRECT MAILING ADDRESS OR YOUR TICKETS ARE OTHERWISE LOST OR NOT DELIVERED, JACKPOCKET SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY FOR LACK OF DELIVERY, INCORRECT DELIVERY OR MISPLACEMENT OF ANY TICKET, ONCE SUCH TICKETS ARE PROVIDED TO THE THIRD PARTY DELIVERY PROVIDER.
Your scratch off tickets will be delivered to you within the Application.
Upon placing an order for scratch off tickets, you will receive an email from Jackpocket confirming the order. Jackpocket will send you a second email confirming when your tickets were delivered to you within the Application. Your order will also be viewable in your transaction history in the mobile application.
If Jackpocket permits Users in Your Jurisdiction to order scratch off tickets to be delivered within the Application, you agree that Jackpocket will scan and scratch the ticket on your behalf, and will provide you with the opportunity to reveal the outcome of the ticket within the Application. The redemption procedures detailed in Section 8 of these Terms of Service shall apply to any such winning ticket that was delivered within the Application. You are responsible for following the terms, conditions and game rules provided on the back side of each ticket and published by the Lottery in Your Jurisdiction.
SCRATCH OFF TICKETS ARE LIMITED BY THE AVAILABILITY OF THE LICENSED RETAILER. YOU ARE NOT GUARANTEED A TICKET AT ALL TIMES. IN THE EVENT THERE IS NO INVENTORY OF A REQUESTED SCRATCH OFF TICKET, YOUR ORDER WILL BE REJECTED. ALL ORDERS PLACED FOR SCRATCH OFF TICKETS THAT ARE NOT REJECTED ARE FINAL.
Jackpocket has the right to void any scratch off tickets that Jackpocket has scanned and scratched on your behalf in the event any such scratch off tickets are damaged, mutilated, altered, unreadable, unredeemable, or incomplete in any manner, as determined by Jackpocket in its sole and absolute discretion, for any reason or no reason.
You agree that the price of the scratch off tickets will count towards any spending limits placed on your Account.

For instance, we may publish "Jack won $100 in Minnesota. Jack picked his numbers based upon family birthdates. Congrats Jack!" 21. Responsible Play
Jackpocket is committed to ensuring the lottery does not turn from a game of fun into a financial issue. Jackpocket warns that for some users, gambling of any kind can be a problem. Jackpocket may permit you to set responsible gaming limits and to self-exclude yourself from use of the Application. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Jackpocket reserves the right to impose stricter limits than those imposed by you and/or exclude you from use of the Application, in each case, in its sole and absolute discretion, for any reason or no reason. More detailed information may be found at https://rg.jackpocket.com/.
NCPG iCAP Certified
Jackpocket is a member of the National Council on Problem Gambling (NCPG). We're certified for responsible gaming through NCPG's assessment program (iCAP). Learn more.
Need additional help?
If you need additional support, the National Council on Problem Gambling (NCPG) offers a number of resources on their website as well as 24-hour confidential helpline at 1-800-522-4700.

argos_summary: The Arkansas Lottery announced the winning numbers for Sunday, Aug. 24, 2025: Cash 3 (3‑7‑0), Cash 4 (4‑3‑3‑3), Lucky For Life (09‑16‑18‑25‑42, Lucky Ball 15), and Natural State Jackpot (04‑06‑08‑15‑19). Draws occur daily at set times, with Powerball, Mega Millions, and other games scheduled throughout the week. Tickets can be purchased in person at retail locations or online via Jackpocket, which serves as the official digital courier for the state lottery. The article also provides links to payout information and reminders about responsible play and claim procedures.
